page.title: 18FARMING
page.content: All the farmers prepare land by ploughing, harrowing + the use of artificial fertilsers and slurry. If the farmers grow crops they practise field rotation.The land icluding grass is sprayed to remove docks and thistles or harrowed. The crops are planted in the autumn or late march and early April,with seed obtained locally from West Cumberland Farmers.Harvesting is from May to November.The cash crop are sold locally at the farms. CATTLE The breeds kept are Charolais,Hereford,limousine,Holstein and mainly Fresian.Most of these are kept for milking.The milk is collected by tanker and taken to the milk marketing board at Aspatria.Most farmers fatten some of their alves + sell others at Cockermouth market.
